page.title: 06BIOGRAPHY _ HENRY TRENGROUSE
page.content: Loe Bar was a notorious place for shipwrecks.In 1807 H.M.S Anson was wrecked on Loe Bar. Henry Trengrouse, a Helston cabinet maker, went to the scene. He was appalled that over one hundred people drowned even though the Anson was almost touching the shore. After watching a firework display he thought of the idea of a rocket line throwing apparatus.He made and perfected a rocket which was fired from a musket and could carry a light line up to two hundred and fifty yards. Then a rope could connect ship and shore. He also invented the bosuns chair to carry people to shore safely. He made a cork lifejacket and designed an unsinkable lifeboat. All this work cost him over three thousand pounds of his own money.His equipment saved many thousands of lives.A monument to Henry Trengrouse stands at Loe Bar.
